name: Quadruped Thoracic Rotation Right
how_to_perform:
1. Start on all fours with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees right underneath your hips.
2. Engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.

3. Place your right hand under your left knee so that it is near your hip (the opposite side of the rotation).
4. Twist your torso and right shoulder blade away from the direction you are facing, keeping the movement smooth and controlled.
5. Hold this position for a moment and focus on the sensation in your thoracic spine.

6. Slowly return to the original hands-and-knees position, then repeat with the other side.
short_summary: Quadruped thoracic rotation works the muscles of your back, specifically targeting the lower thoracic region
